args.natural_language_statement: Let n ≥ 6 and let N be a proper normal subgroup of A_n. Show that N contains every subgroup G_i = {σ ∈ A_n : σ(i) = i} for each 1 ≤ i ≤ n.

retrieved_examples.nl: Let n≥5 and let N be a proper normal subgroup of A_n. Show that N contains every subgroup G_i={σ∈A_n:σ(i)=i} for each 1≤i≤n.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

open Subgroup

/-!
Statement: For n ≥ 5, any proper normal subgroup N of the alternating group A_n contains the point-stabiliser subgroups G_i = {σ ∈ A_n | σ i = i} for each i.
Note: This file only states the lemma; the proof is omitted (``by sorry'').
-/

variable {n : ℕ}

-- We work with permutations of Fin n and the alternating subgroup of even permutations.
variable (hn : 5 ≤ n)

/-- Placeholder for the alternating group on Fin n. In mathlib this is `AlternatingGroup (Fin n)`.
We state the lemma about normal subgroups of this alternating group. -/
lemma proper_normal_contains_point_stabilisers (N : Subgroup (Equiv.Perm (Fin n))) (hNnormal : N.normal) (hNproper : N ≠ (Subgroup.top : Subgroup (Equiv.Perm (Fin n)))) :
  -- For each i, the point stabiliser G_i (inside A_n) is contained in N.
  ∀ i : Fin n, let G_i := {σ : Equiv.Perm (Fin n) | σ i = i} in (G_i : Set (Equiv.Perm (Fin n))) ⊆ (N : Set (Equiv.Perm (Fin n))) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Equiv

/-
For n ≥ 6, any proper normal subgroup N of the alternating group A_n contains the
point-stabiliser subgroups G_i = {σ ∈ A_n | σ i = i} for each i.

This file only states the lemma; the proof is omitted (``by sorry'').
-/

variable {n : ℕ}

theorem proper_normal_subgroup_of_An_contains_point_stabilisers
  (hn : 6 ≤ n)
  (N : Subgroup (Perm (Fin n)))
  (hNnormal : N.normal)
  (hNsub : N ≤ AlternatingGroup (Fin n))
  (hNproper : N ≠ AlternatingGroup (Fin n)) :
  ∀ i : Fin n,
    ({ σ : Perm (Fin n) | σ i = i } ∩ (AlternatingGroup (Fin n) : Set (Perm (Fin n)))) ⊆ (N : Set (Perm (Fin n))) := by sorry
